post.summary: Create an iwoca account for a new customer
post.description: The POST request should be used to create an iwoca account for the customer. It’s always the first endpoint and method you should call when submitting a new customer. We’ll return a state_key used to identify the customer in all future requests. Almost all fields in the State are optional since you can submit a partial application initially, then add or update data over time (through the PUT method). Your iwoca contact will be able to give you details on which fields are recommended to help us make a lending decision.

data.description: Present only if the request went fine.

parameters.name: state_key
parameters.description: The state_key used to represent a customer.

put.summary: Update iwoca account information for a specific customer
put.description: The PUT request should be used to add or update data for a customer. Note that the entire State needs to be submitted each time you use this endpoint, even if you are just updating a few fields.

post.description: This endpoint SHOULD live on the partner side. It allows to get informed about an event happening on iwoca system. partner_webhook_url should be replaced with any partner url wanted.

parameters.name: X-IW-Event-Type
parameters.description: The event type sent by iwoca.

parameters.name: X-IW-Event-ID
parameters.description: The event id sent by iwoca.

parameters.name: X-IW-Signature
parameters.description: HMAC hex digest of the payload.

get.summary: Generate a one time login link for the user's iwoca account
get.description:
The GET request will return a one-time login link that the user can follow to get into their iwoca account (on iwoca.co.uk) without entering a password.

You can generate multiple login links which will be active simultaneously. However, all links will expire when the user next logs into their iwoca account (either by following one of the links or by entering their username and password).

parameters.name: state_key
parameters.description: The state_key used to represent a customer.

get.description: Returning the repayment schedule for a customer, with possible early repayment or new draw-down simulation.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Specify which simulation mode this repayment schedule should take into account.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount you want to repay or draw-down. If not specified, will return the current loan schedule, if any.

200.description: Repayment schedule for a specific customer.

parameters.name: state_key
parameters.description: The state_key used to represent a customer.

post.summary: Triggers a credit decision for a given customer
post.description: This method should be used when a decision needs to be made for a customer. It doesn't expect any payload, all needed information should have been provided in the state of the customer.

get.description: The Accept header should match the file_format query parameter if both are given.

brand.description: Brand of the payment method, if applicable.

datetime.description: The date and time of the most recent charge attempt in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: The state of the attempted charge.

last_digits.description: The last digits of the payment method.

payment_method_id.description: Unique identifier used for referencing the payment method within iwoca systems.

registered_at.description: Date & time of when the given payment method was linked.

provider.description: The payment processor this payment method is registered with.

payment_method_id.description: Unique identifier used for referencing the payment method within iwoca systems.

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Fetch payment instructions whose latest status update was after the supplied date time.

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: Fetch payment instructions whose latest status update was up to the supplied date time.

parameters.name: outcome
parameters.description: The current outcome recorded for the payment instruction.

parameters.name: error_code
parameters.description: The error code supplied for a failed payment instruction.

parameters.name: state_key
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the customer.

parameters.name: payment_instruction_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the payment instruction.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page displayed, used to paginate the results.

parameters.name: state_key
parameters.description: The state_key used to represent a customer.

get.summary: Get credit facility information for a given customer
get.description: The data returned contains information like approval status, loan status, repayments, cashflows, ...

facilityStatus.description:
- U: Unclassified - The member is unable to make any statement, whether positive or adverse on the performance of this facility for the period in question. A \'U\' may also be used during the initial period of a facility’s life when the first payment is yet to be made (maximum 2 months excepting \'buy now pay later\' facilities).
- D: Dormant – The facility has been inactive for a period of time, usually with a zero balance. This code should be supplied each and every month until the facility is used again or closed.
- 0: In advance, up-to-date or less than one payment due but unpaid.
- 1: More than one but less than two payments due but unpaid.
- 2: More than two but less than three payments due but unpaid.
- 3: More than three but less than four payments due but unpaid.
- 4: More than four but less than five payments due but unpaid.
- 5: More than five but less than six payments due but unpaid.
- 6: Six or more payments due but unpaid.
- 8: Defaulted Balance- At the date of default the customer had failed to meet the contractual obligations and had failed to satisfactorily respond to requests that the facility be put into order. The circumstances where a facility should be defaulted are more fully explained in the guidance note on the filing of defaults and members are advised to follow this as a guide to best practice.
- S: Settled – The facility has been settled within the terms of the agreement terms and is closed.  For Facility Type 15, Current Accounts, this indicates the Current Account was closed with a zero or credit balance.

enum: Hire purchase (including Lease Purchase)/ Conditional sale
Customer ceases to meet the definition of a small or medium
Subject ceases to be a customer
Business name or address of a default (status 8) record has changed

post.summary: Credit facility payment request (with payment method)

api_errors.title: api_errors
api_errors.description: Present only if there was any issue during the request processing.

items.description: Partial representation of an error as described in http://jsonapi.org/format/#errors.

datetime.description: Date-time the transaction occurred, with expected ISO 8601 format.

payment_method_bank_details.title: payment_method_bank_details
payment_method_bank_details.description: Details of the business bank account used for funding or repayments.

approval_request.title: approval_request
approval_request.description: Latest approval request description. If no decision is possible, data_errors will detail the reasons.

approval_status.title: approval_status
approval_status.description: Approval decision for a customer. Additional information depending on the status will appear in declined/approved sections.

status.description: Note: "deferred" is a new enum option as of January 2020

repayment_schedule.title: repayment_schedule
repayment_schedule.description: Payments schedule to repay the current loan.

date.description: Date when the repayment must happen

total.description: Total amount to be repaid. Sum of all other amounts.

total_fees.description: If applicable, fees to be repaid. Interest is not considered as fees and appears in its own section.

interval.description: Interval between repayments, examples: 7d / 1m. Customers are put on a one month schedule by default and this would not typically be asked during the application journey.

max_principal.description: Rate applied up to this max_principal amount.

rates.description: List of rates. Several rates can be applied to different principal amounts.

effective_on_day.description: When this rate is effective. 0 means the first day of the loan.

rate_structures.description: Different applicable rates for this specific approval.

duration.description: Requested loan duration in months. For instance, an interval of 1m and a duration of 12 would correspond to a one year loan paid back in monthly instalments. In cases where the interval is not specified as a number of months, the actual duration will be rounded up to be a whole number of intervals (taking a month as 30 days).

min_credit.description: Minimum credit allowed to be taken.

bank_details.title: bank_details
bank_details.description: Details of the business bank account used for funding.

data.description: Sent with approval_status_changed event: latest_approval_request / approval_status / approval_requirements.

application.description: Data submitted by the customer about themselves, their company or their funding requirements. If this data changes over time, you should update the state to reflect the latest data or requirements.

people.description: People associated with the company including the applicant and any other directors, shareholders or loan guarantors you wish to submit.

partner.description: Supplemental data that the partner holds on the customer. This should not be exposed to the customer since it may contain sensitive details such as the verification_data array.

customer_type.description: Any categorisation of the customer held by the partner that may be required when reporting back data or that should affect the journey (as agreed between iwoca and partner). For example, you might submit 'VIP_customer' if you wanted to track SLAs for these customers separately.

amount.description: Submitted in cases where the partner has shown a customer an approval amount or a pre-qualified amount based on some data they hold. This should only be done with prior agreement from iwoca.

rate.description: Submitted in cases where the partner has shown a customer an expected monthly rate (including interest and fees) . This should only be done with prior agreement from iwoca.

introducer_email.description: Used by partners to tell iwoca which of their introducer's accounts should be linked to the application submitted.

verified_data.description: In certain situations, a partner may be trusted by iwoca to verify that certain pieces of data have already been checked. For example, the partner may have already verified the customer's phone number so there is no need for iwoca to do it again. This section is used for submitting data on any verification that has taken place. It must not be exposed to customers. The structure follows the structure of the application section.

schema_version.description: This field is ignored in POST/PUT requests.

state_key.description: This field is ignored in POST/PUT requests.

version.description: This field is used for optimistic concurrency control. In response to a GET request the version represents the latest stored version of the state. In the payload of a PUT request it represents the version of the state that the client was editing, which would have been received in a response to an earlier GET request. This field will only be returned in GET requests if you have been opted into optimistic concurrency control. It should never be supplied with POST requests but should be supplied with PUT requests if you have been opted into optimistic concurrency control.

verification_method.description: Method of verification, depending on data type (e.g. 'Penny transfer' for bank_details or 'SMS code' for phone_number).

verified.description: If verified is true, specifies that you are confident that this piece of data is valid, in line with any contractual obligations you have on checking and validating data.

last_12_months_profit.description: All essential personal expenses, apart from housing. For example, food, transport and other loan repayments. Required for lending to sole traders.

amount.description: Pre-tax amount submitted by customer in pounds. Note that this differs from monthly_non_business_income which is post-tax.

datetime.description: Datetime when user submitted data, with expected ISO 8601 format.

vat_status.description: Information on the company's VAT registration status.

registered_company_name.description: Registered company name for a registered business such as a limited company, as on Companies House.

industry.description: Recommended value is one of: Agriculture, Forestry & Fishing; Architecture & Engineering; Business Support Services; Car Dealers, Garages & Mechanics; Cleaning, Landscaping & Gardening; Construction; Education & Training; Finance & Insurance; Health & Care; Hotels, Restaurants & Pubs; IT & Communications; Leisure / Other Services; Manufacturing, Food Processing & Printing; Professional Services; Property & Real Estate; Publishing, Film & Media Production; Retail; Transport & Logistics; Wholesale; Other.

company_number.description: Company number as on Companies House.

third_party_providers.description: Details of third-party providers used by the business such as Xero, eBay, PayPal or others.

name.description: Recommended values for major banks: barclays, hsbc, lloyds, natwest, santander, other. Recommended values for software: xero, kashflow, sage-one, sage-50, other. Recommended values for ecommerce: ebay, amazon, paypal-classic, ekm, shopify, skrill, sagepay, other.

last_12_months_turnover.description: Estimated revenue over the last 12 months. For a young business without a full year of revenue, revenue to date should be given.

amount.description: Amount submitted by customer in pounds or other estimate.

datetime.description: Datetime when user submitted data, with expected ISO 8601 format.

trading_from_date.description: Date when company started trading, with expected ISO 8601 format.

trading_name.description: Primary company name used for sole traders and ordinary partnerships, otherwise registered name will typically be used.

agreed.description: Specify if user has opted in to receive marketing emails from iwoca.

datetime.description: Datetime when they opted in or out of marketing emails, with expected ISO 8601 format.

uid.description: Unique identifier created and stored by the partner which will allow you to retrieve/update this data in the future.

residential_status.description: The rent_free option covers situations where they are living in a property that they don't own but they are not paying rent (e.g. living with parents or family).

monthly_housing_expenses.description: Monthly cost of rent or mortgage, depending on residential status, at this address. Required for lending to sole traders.

datetime.description: Datetime when user submitted data, with expected ISO 8601 format.

date_from.description: Date with expected ISO 8601 format. Optionally specify the date when they moved to this address. This date can be an estimate.

uid.description: Unique identifier created and stored by the partner which will allow you to retrieve/update this data in the future.

roles.description: There should only be one applicant but may be multiple people with the other roles.

monthly_non_housing_expenses.description: All essential personal expenses, apart from housing. For example, food, transport and other loan repayments. Required for lending to sole traders.

amount.description: Amount submitted by customer in pounds.

datetime.description: Datetime when user submitted data, with expected ISO 8601 format.

monthly_other_household_income.description: Total income from other members of the applicant's household such as their wife or husband. Does not include their own income.

datetime.description: Datetime when user submitted data, with expected ISO 8601 format.

number_of_dependents.description: Number of people that are financially dependent on the person (such as children or people in their care).

datetime.description: Datetime when user submitted data, with expected ISO 8601 format.

items.description: Contact phone numbers. It's preferable to have both a primary and secondary phone number for the applicant if available.

uid.description: Unique identifier created and stored by the partner which will allow you to retrieve/update this data in the future.

number.description: Quite flexible, can handle with/without country code, e.g. +447778473883 / 07778473883.

agreed.description: Specify whether the user has agreed to the iwoca privacy policy.

datetime.description: Datetime when they agreed or disagreed with the iwoca privacy policy, with expected ISO 8601 format.

agreed.description: Specify whether the user has agreed to an extended credit check.

datetime.description: Datetime when they agreed or disagreed to an extended credit check, with expected ISO 8601 format.

monthly_non_business_income.description: All income from other jobs, pension etc. Required for lending to sole traders.

amount.description: Post-tax amount submitted by customer in pounds. Note that this differs from monthly_business_income which is pre-tax.

datetime.description: Datetime when user submitted data, with expected ISO 8601 format.

uid.description: Unique identifier created and stored by the partner which will allow you to retrieve/update this data in the future.

email.description: Contact email address with format user@example.com (ideally not a generic address such as info@...).

answer.description: Enum denoting where the customer heard about us.

document_id.description: Unique identifier for an uploaded document.

upload_date.description: Datetime that the document was uploaded

loan_status.description: Status of current or last loan.

balance.description: Balance for this credit facility as of today.

cashflows.description: Cashflows related to this loan. Mainly funding and repayments.

amount.description: Amount that the user is looking to get approved for.

interval.description: Interval between repayments, examples: 7d / 1m. Customers are put on a one month schedule by default and this would not typically be asked during the application journey.

duration.description: Requested loan duration in months. For instance, an interval of 1m and a duration of 12 would correspond to a one year loan paid back in monthly instalments. In cases where the interval is not specified as a number of months, the actual duration will be rounded up to be a whole number of intervals (taking a month as 30 days).

purpose.description: A purpose may not be submitted if the customer is simply looking to get approved for the future, rather than a specific need.

detailed_purpose.description: detailed_purpose is usually submitted if a purpose of other has been set.

urgency.description: Describes whether the customer needs the funding immediately (asap), over the next few weeks (weeks) or is simply looking to get approved for future use (future).

amount.description: Amount that the user is looking to drawdown.

provider.description: The payment processor that provided the token.

token.description: Token provided by the payment processor referring to a certain payment method registered with them.
